snippet: At the Windward School in Manhattan, children with learning disabilities learn to connect words to their meanings through multiple senses, including shaping letters out of clay....
abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column profiles Windward School in Manhattan, which seeks to teach children with learning disabilities and return them to mainstream schools with skills to help them thrive; school's strategy is to connect words to their meaning through different senses, and follow-up surveys show that students retain their skills well into high school.
lead_paragraph: At the Windward School in Manhattan, children with learning disabilities learn to connect words to their meanings through multiple senses, including shaping letters out of clay.

headline.print_headline: A School Where the Students Learn to Read by Sculpting Words
headline.main: A New York School Where Students Learn to Read by Sculpting Words
